The last thing that I wanted to eat what a mile high "pancakey crepe" with crabmeat, mushrooms, spinach and parmesan cheese sauce.  Yuck!  This dish was not that.  It was delicious with real crabmeat and not that weird fake stuff.  Nothing was overwhelming and everything melded together nicely. The fruit cup was also a nice accompaniment to the crepes and  was also a wonderful "dead of winter" touch.  Someone actually took the time to cut fresh fruit. (I know that sounds crazy, but do you know how often fresh fruit comes straight from the can?)  Muff's pumpkin walnut pancakes and chicken apple sausage were also nicely comforting and delicious.  Square Caf√© is a nice homey place where you can tell the owners and staff care about their food and their customers.  I guess that I'm just jealous that I don't have a similar place nearby that serves high quality ingredients in a relaxed atmosphere.    Hey Square Care owners, can you open a place near me?

Hopefully I can re-review this review another time. I arrived for a late breakfast with my son, we sat outside, coffee and OJ arrived quickly. So, I thought good start right? Well, I was wrong. His meal came out just as quick and so did mines. However, his was cooked and mines not at all.   I ordered the Pumpkin pancake, and it was RAW! I waited nearly 10 minutes for a wait staff, and eventually went to seek one on my own to let them know.   They were truly kind about the matter, and quickly brought out a new one. Unfortunately that too was raw, pasty and flat. I didn't even bother putting it in my mouth. I showed the waiter, he too agreed that it was raw, apologized and took the $4 off my bill. Unfortunately that was it , so I left with a stomach filled with only coffee and a $17 and change tab to pay for waiting 30 minutes for a meal I could eat.

It really is about as good as it gets as far as breakfast joints go in Pittsburgh.  We often don't enjoy eating out for breakfast for the simple reason its often nothing special.  Square Cafe is a refreshing change of course.  They have the breakfast staples, yet manage to execute them better.  Not greasy, always fresh, and always leave happy.  They do a lot of twists to make things more interesting.  My personal favorite are their takes on eggs Benedict.  Their summer menu had it made with beef short ribs and side of salad greens.  The fall version uses crab cakes with a side of salad greens.  It is a perfect breakfast, tasty, hardy, but not overwhelming.  Their crepes, pancakes, and anything they do with smoked salmon are also great.  They have brew a great cup of coffee as well.  Their breakfast prices are somewhat more than some other establishments, but its worth it.  We always leave feeling that we made a right choice for breakfast.

Brunch time!  My wife and I were definitely a fan of the Square Cafe.  This review has been a long time coming since I almost forgot I had eaten here.  FOR SHAME! We really enjoyed sitting outside on the sidewalk in the cozy little neighborhood of Regent Square while sipping Squares quality coffee and having a nice brunch.  The service was great and friendly and our food was almost very very good.  I had the Square Protein breakfast with eggs that were oozing that yolky goodness.  And my better half had an omelete with spinach and feta, she didn't speak much during the meal, so that's a plus.  LOL.   I would highly recommend spending a nice late morning/early afternoon meal outside of Square. I also heard they have tons of vegan and vegetarian options, but why?!
Extremely underwhelming. My Brussels sprout hash was hardly cooked. The mushrooms and Brussels sprouts were nearly raw and had no flavor. Disappointing!

Great breakfast and coffee. The restaurant itself is really cute. There's a chalkboard people draw on in the bathroom too, which is not super special or anything, I know, but it's the little things that make cafes like this fun.   There's a nice coffee bar to sit at if you're by yourself too.   I had the short rib omelette which was very good. The coffee is good too and they come in these cute "square" mugs.   Seating is indoor and outdoor, but if you're sitting outside there are some awkward moments when people are parallel parking next to you. Otherwise, it's fine.   As with any brunch place in a trendy neighborhood, be prepared for a wait on weekends! On weekdays, seating is plentiful, and they open early.

After getting over paying $4 for 2 biscuits I got comfortable with the scene. The food is great. I had the special of the day and destroyed my crab cake sliders in record timing. I'm glad before ordering it I asked the stranger next to me how he was enjoying his because he was right it did need a little bit more sauce. I ordered extra sauce and drizzled it over the crab cake and it was necessary. It also elevated it quite a bit. The first time I was here I had breakfast and a smoothie and it was delicious. This go around I decided to try their lattes. The Rocky Road one was okay. It wasn't sweet enough but I guess that's a matter of preference. I like my espresso to taste flavorful with a splash of coffee. The staff here are pretty awesome and accommodating as my friend who I was with was pretty demanding about her hash and the bread it came with. I'd definitely say this place is up there with Pamela's Diner it's just a bit pricier.

I'm serious about my breakfast and this place lived up to every expectation. I love to try to make healthier versions of my favorite foods and they seem to do that with some of their options as well. The atmosphere was really nice. Located on a somewhat busy street, the outdoor seating did not feel like it at all and the cozy tables made me nostalgic for the quaint cafes located on the streets of Paris. The staff was friendly and the place was bright and cheery.    My husband ordered the chorizo bowl and loved it. It's hard to go wrong with eggs, meat, cheese, and veggies on a bed of tots.    I ordered the pearly white omelet (which was more of a scramble but i don't care about titles). The pesto was such a nice touch and they let me swap the tomatoes for mushrooms with no problem. I'm a little hesitant when fruit cup is offered because it's never fresh but their fruit was so crisp and delicious. After much of my own experiments with protein pancakes, i know that they can be pretty dense but they kept a good amount of fluff and the chocolate chips were a nice touch! I love that they offer a single pancake because i never like to get the pancakes for my meal because it's always just a bit too much for me in terms of sweet and since food is my love language, i love to try as many things on the menu as possible.   If you're in Pittsburgh, this place is definitely worth it.

I love LOVE the square cafe! it's such a cozy little cafe filled with neat local artists work and they offer amazing drinks and food!   i had their pumpkin chi tea and it fit right into my tea fetish! it's creamy and full of spicy flavor, way better than Starbucks chi tea.          I always get the shrimp and crab cake sandwich, it's filling and the taste is just what you want out of sandwich. It's food you know is made of a good quality and they offer good vegetarian options.         If your like me and tired of nasty second rate chain restaurant food then you feel right at home here!

Great brunch spot with plenty of vegetarian and vegan options. The line builds up early on weekends so get there as soon as you can or you may find yourself waiting 30+ minutes (I once had to wait over an hour). However, I've frequented this restaurant many times while attending college in Pittsburgh and any potential wait time is definitely worth the wait. I'd recommend starting off with some coffee, served in their signature square mugs. Then, I typically get the veggie scramble with goat cheese as my entree. This is served with toast, a couple orange slices, and home fries. The legendary home fries are HANDS DOWN the main reason I've frequented Square Cafe so much. The potatoes are the perfect level of crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, with a nice seasoning of salt and pepper. I may even go as far to say I like these potatoes more than Pamela's potato hash... but you can be the judge of that on your next brunch here ;)

The theme of this place is a little useless:  there are many things in the cafe that are shaped like squares of rectangles, including the mugs -- which I feel are a pain to drink coffee from, and I like my coffee comfortalbe.  They have vintage lunchboxes on display on their wall, so be prepared to have them become the center of your conversation every time you go there because The Last Starfighter will spark a blast from the past.  You should do that over one of their cookies because their baked goods are off tha hook.  I went with a big group of my boyfriend's friends on New Year's Day after a night of partying, and they were open!  Everyone's food looked delicious.  I ordered the green eggs breakfast which may sound like barf-o-rama but actually was phenomenal: the green comes from pesto.

As cute as the Square Cafe is, it just just kind of... square. I visited the cafe during July, so my group of three wanted to sit outside. The inside was kind of tight, anyway. We waited for over 45 minutes to get a table and awkward around all of the people sitting outside but there wasn't anywhere else to stand. When we were finally seated, it took our server forever to even bring us our drinks. Later, when the food finally arrived, I was disappointed. If I'm going to wait for an hour and a half in total to get my food, it better be amazing. This was pretty average.

It's been ages since I have been to Square Cafe...when I say ages - I mean years.  But I had a surprise Friday off - so it was a perfect day to meet a friend for a scrumptious breakfast.  We were looking for a place close to both of us that wasn't a chain - I finally remembered Square Cafe and was so glad I did!  While it was a Friday at breakfast time (8:30a) we were easily able to get an inside table.  Unfortunately it was a little too chilly to take advantage of the outside tables.  But I very much look forward to taking advantage of them soon!  Our waitress was awesome, the food was amazing.  The best part - they didn't mind that we sat there for a bit longer to chat.  My friend got a coffee - they even offered her a cup of it to go!  Anyways - get to Square Cafe.  It is SO good, so fun, and so worth it.

We visited Square two times last month, and we are happy to report that we had a great experience. The service was great, and the food was delicious. Whatever was going awry last summer seems to have been transient. Square, you're back on my list!

A really cool place to go to eat, and the food is good.  They have some outside seating which is nice on beautiful days!   I had the Hazelnut Espresso pancakes, they were really good.   I'd love to go there for Brunch sometime.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday. It was quite busy, so there was about a half hour wait. We were a large party, so it was expected. The inside has a cute and friendly vibe. My friend and I shared the breakfast burrito and cinnamon roll pancakes. The breakfast burrito was excellent as the tortilla was seasoned with spices, which really made a difference. The burrito was filled with eggs, mushrooms, cheese, onions and came with sour cream and salsa. The cinamon roll pancakes were beautifully presented as they had a swirl pattern and drizzled with a cream cheese frosting. They also tasted amazing as well. The prices are very reasonable, too. A great place to grab brunch!
Why did I ever give this place less than five stars?  Try the...try it all.  Funky fun and love it here.

Regent Square is never a 'destination' of mine, unless I actually hear of something interesting playing at the Regent Square Theater. Regent Square is usually a 'pass through' en route to the Habitat for Humanity Restore, or a cut off the parkway heading for Squirrel Hill. But this morning a friend was braving the blizzard for an acupuncture session in Regent Square, and we hit the Square Cafe for breakfast.  I had seen the lines when occasionally passing through, and had seen previous reviews talking about the place being packed with a wait, so this morning the blizzard was serendipitous to our being able to get in with no problems.   We only had about 30 minutes to order, eat and run, and so we did just that. First came the coffee...not bad...not quite a thick rich cup that my mouth generally prefers (I am a big fan of coffee with coffee in it, like Cuban, Turkish, Arabic - not just brown Pittsburgh water) but it wasn't just (as my late best friend and I used to call it) TEAffee. It was a decent cup of morning Joe-merican. I do have to say that the coffee cups were a little weird, and took some adjusting to drink out of.  Prices? A little high for breakfast, but manageable. I didn't have a lot of time to scope all of the options, but in the time that I did have, I looked through the crepes and egg options, trying to keep carbs at a minimum. Most of the descriptions included either 'onions' or 'peppers', which my stomach can't handle at the best of times, definitely not for breakfast, and although some of them looked good if the onions or peppers weren't there, I didn't have time to play Meg Ryan in 'When Harry Met Sally', so I just opted for what I knew I could have, and ordered the chicken crepe with leeks.  Very tasty, decent size. I did kind of get the feeling that perhaps the crepe had been pre-made and then filled, because portions of the crepe were definitely cold, whereas the filling was quite piping hot. Nonetheless, it was a delicious and filling quick breakfast option.   The waitress was excellent, fast, friendly, and accommodating, even allowing us to take what was left of our coffee to go, since we were running late for his poking appointment (as we drank coffee, my mind envisioned him getting acupuncture, and then like a cartoon, erupting like a coffee sprinkler system), and she topped off the paper cups for us.   Now I'm not so sure that I would wait in a line for very long for a table, or that I would say 'Hey, let's go THERE for breakfast' since I don't live in the area. But if I was in the area, and another natural disaster prevented the trendy throngs from leaving their houses to stand in a line for some eggs, I'd certainly give it another go.

i would have never even known about this place had i not stumbled upon it in a deck of city dining cards. i'm very glad i did. for the dining cards to give you the discount, you have to spend at least $30. i went with a friend, and we had to order 3 entrees and 2 coffee drinks to even get there! needless to say, the prices are reasonable. i just had a simple coffee, but my friend had some sort of pumpkin latte which was very tasty. we ordered the mediterranean omelet (delish.. anything with feta is good with me), the canadian bacon and avocado crepe (combination i never would have thought of but was blown away by), and the mac 'n' cheese (i can't remember what gourmet cheese was on it, but it was good, although kind of bland.. we added salt and pepper). the omelet came with toast and home fries and the mac 'n' cheese with "greens" (mixed greens sprinkled with a little dressing on the side.. not a full salad, but you get the idea). i'd definitely go back, although let me explain the two reasons i gave the place 4 instead of 5 stars. first, the mac 'n' cheese, like i mentioned was rather bland. it wasn't bad, but after trying the first two we were quite disappointed. second, about half way through the meal, they randomly opened the door and left it open. we were sitting at the bar, pretty much right in front of the door and it was freezing outside. we asked them to close it and they did, but really? it's winter, how was that a good idea?

One of my favorite breakfast places! They have a ton of vegan/vegetarian/gluten-free options which is great. They can get pretty crowded on the weekends, so visit them on a weekday morning if you can. Order the brussel sprout hash!!!!

Good food with lots of vegan/vegetarian options.  Moderately priced and haven't had to wait for a table.  Service is always friendly and knowledgeable.  Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because they don't have avocados as an option.  My own personal bias, but I love that lesbians come here :)

Enjoyed breakfast here two days this past weekend. First day had the tofu scramble which is not scrambled tofu, but rather cubed tofu over "riced" cauliflower. I very much enjoyed having a vegetarian option for breakfast that wasn't pancakes. Next morning I had a veggie omelet with the pearl cheese that they make in house. My dining companion had the pulled pork special over grits and liked it as well. Make no mistake, this is a very busy place but the service is top-notch. Especially appreciated the guys at the counter on Saturday. Very pleasant.

Back again!! Sat inside today..... slightly chilly out but as we were leaving I noticed many guests had the same blue blankets on! So cute.   I don't like sitting inside as much but there wasn't a wait. It's just a little too close for comfort. Kinda noisy. But all in an upbeat kinda way.   But. The. Food. Oh man. Totally makes up for it. Got the braised short rib crepes and they were phenomenal. Savory amazingness. Also had the churry (?) chai beverage. Wow. Sooo good.   Our server was super awesome as well. Square Cafe is always a good call :)

Usually a wait here for brunch, and not a lot of room on the street to stand and wait with the rest of the crowd. Otherwise, the food is pretty good, I like the Brussel sprouts hash and their juices! They have had a group for a while, it's a really incredible deal for good food if it's still there!

This place is in my neighborhood and, on prime brunch days, there is ALWAYS a line spilling out of the restaurant and into the street. To be honest, I'm not really sure why? I've eaten here twice and both times I left underwhelmed.   I don't mind paying premium prices for meals that reflect the price point but Square Cafe seems needlessly expensive. Four dollars extra for a croissant? You can get an expertly baked croissant at the French bakery down the street for less money than that. Literally. Square Cafe also doesn't participate in the widely accepted breakfast/brunch tradition of including a toast and potato option with one's entree of choice- instead requiring people pay an additional $6.25 ON TOP of a "meal" that is already setting you back $9-$15.  I think two tries is more than fair enough. I honestly prefer the Swissvale Eat n Park. Shrug.

A-OK  Had the brussel hash. Very good, large portion. Added an extra egg.   Just wish the dish included cheesy/more cheesy grits. I actually ordered through UberEATS. Food was hot upon arrival, and delish.   Will definitely order or go to try more of the dishes.

The food was good, but not great (I had the vegetable crepes and my husband had the breakfast sandwich). Maybe we ordered the wrong items - but I think that if we want breakfast, we will be sticking with Pamela's.

After going to Square Cafe twice during peak brunch times, I have resolved to come early in the morning, which is perfect. Nice selection of breakfast items from your sweet to savory and for reasonable prices though I feel like they have changed the menu recently so that there are less items. Anyway I don't get the name of the cafe but there are shapes (not just squares) painted on the ceiling in bold colors with local art work hanging so it is a comfortable atmosphere.   The service has been good - coffee is always filled (cups that the coffee come in are shaped interestingly cool) and the waitresses check in at reasonable times with a smile on their face. They are there to get you in and out with a full belly due to the volume of customers.  I've eaten quite a few of their scrambles and omlettes along with their home fries and toast. The combinations of the flavors work well and homefries don't need any additional seasoning unless ketchup. Pancakes are fluffy and sweet, love how there is a dallop of whipped butter and whip cream. I have yet to have the french toast but my boyfriend always orders them with strawberries.  This is a staple breakfast place for us.

So I'm having a difficult time with this review.  I went here around 1 on a weekday, and I was feeling a veggie burger.  All of the omelette, pancake, and crepe options sounded delicious to me, but I ordered the veggie burger and fries. The fries were awesome, but the burger was just okay for me. I blame myself because I should have gotten a breakfast item from the menu.  All of the tables around me ordered breakfast items and their dishes looked wonderful.  Our service was pretty average, and the atmosphere was fun.  I will have to go back and get something for breakfast one of these days for a second opinion!

We had a large party and needed two highchairs, and even though Square Cafe doesn't take reservations they will make a "note" of your party's size and arrival time if you call a few days before hand, which we did and they were able to accommodate us. The hostess was great and worked with us to get us seated as soon as our whole party arrived.   Our waitress was friendly and made sure we understood the surcharge on eggs due to the current avian flu shortage. She refilled coffee and waters in a timely manner, and provided the toddler with us crayons and an activity place mat which was very much appreciated.   Everyone enjoyed their breakfasts and one member of our party really like that she could substitute the buttermilk pancake for a cinnamon swirl pancake with the square breakfast, for an additional charge. Also, the variety of sausage available almost made me change my order from bacon to the chicken apple sausage, oh well next time...   My sunny side up eggs and home fries hit the spot, and my husband DEVOURED his Say Uncle Hot Sausage Hash. Overall, everyone at the table was pleased with their meals.   We'll definitely be back, because I still need to try that chicken apple sausage.

I absolutely love coming to this restaurant! The staff (who doesn't appear to turn over--a testament to the ownership) is constantly friendly, despite not being a "regular" I'm in enough that they always remember me and greet me with a smile, not to mention the coffee is always flowing! I've never had a bad meal here! Lima bean bisque, Ruben pirogies! You name it. One of these days I'm going to buy a coffee mug too, they're incredible.

I've been here for lunch/breakfast several times, I'm lucky that it's only a 15 minute walk from my apartment.  The last time I came for lunch it was busy. There was a wait for a table so we sat at the bar. Ten minutes after we placed our order a woman came up to the bar and complained that her food was taking a long time, the barista kindly explained that everyone's food was taking longer than usual and it will be out as soon as it's ready.  Fifteen minutes later a server came to us with two plates, but only one was correct. I told her that the dish in her other hand was not what I ordered, so she gave my friend her french toast with strawberries (which she loved). My server appeared out of nowhere and all ready knew the situation. She said that the food runner must have given us another customer's order and that my dish would take a little bit longer. I thanked her and told her it was no big deal and I didn't mind waiting. Five minutes later my asparagus and goat cheese scramble arrived, and it was well worth the wait. Although I am not a fan of sun dried tomatoes; next time I will see if they can make it without. Our server apologized profusely for the mistake. I'm a server as well, and I know these mistakes happen. It didn't bother me one bit. A few minutes later our server surprised us with 2 strawberry graham cracker milkshakes!! Although I am gluten intolerant (which she did not know), the gesture was greatly appreciated (and my friend was ok with taking mine home!).  The white bean hash is my favorite thing here! It is gluten free also! It has a ton of flavor and textures and eggs are always cooked perfectly. My friend said the pumpkin spiced latte was the best she has ever had.   This restaurant consistently serves quality meals with great flavor at a fair price. The servers and baristas are personable, friendly, and down to earth. Make sure to stop in and try it if you haven't!

I've been looking forward to trying out this place for some time now. It was a beautiful day and outdoor seating was available. When I arrived I was told to have a seat at one of the small tables.   I was having a hard time deciding whether or not to go for breakfast or lunch but then decided to do sort of a mix. I ordered the chicken crepes with mushrooms and Asiago cheese. I learned that they promote other small businesses in some of their menu offerings and the cheese on my crepes was homemade. I got my food fairly quickly. Although I couldn't see the crepes for the cheese it was so good!! They have some new offerings on their spring menu including some vegetarian choices.   I was chatting at the next table with someone who had ordered the chicken salad in paninis. It came with French Fries. He told me it was delicious! The place wasn't overly crowded when I arrived and I saw they have two gender neutral bathrooms.  Expect to pay anywhere over $10.00 for your meal but when I compare it against some of the chain restaurants that  charge the same amount you get more bang for your buck here. The food is indeed filling but in case you have room then they serve milkshakes and smoothies. Kids' meals are a flat $6.50. They also do catering here.  Also along their walls they put up various artwork which is for sale. Online ordering is also available. Some of the local vendors they promote are Emerald Valley artisans, King's pearl cheese, and Nancy B's bakery. One final note which is most often overlooked on the menu. There is a sharing fee of $2.50. Please be aware of that when ordering. I am anxious to return sometime in the future to try out their breakfasts. I was told the Brussels sprouts hash is what they are noted for.

I don't get it.  Why is this place super popular?  The coffee is killer and the service *can be* excellent... but the food is mega over priced and mediocre at best.    I've attempted this place a couple times, ordering totally different dishes and have given up.  Either they don't understand how to make food flavorful, or they don't care.    Pancakes shouldn't be batter in the middle, a veggie breakfast burrito SHOULD NOT be $11...unless it's the size of a toddler, a breakfast tofu scramble should not have blocks of saut√©ed tofu in it (are you new?), and I shouldn't spend $40 on breakfast for two people...no booze involved, just food.    I really wanted to like this place but it's honestly not worth it.

Tasty! I had a smoked salmon crepe, my wife had veggie, both excellent. Close to the Frick museum, 1 hr on street parking is free**  **Update 7/23/2014**  Square Cafe sent me a message that the parking isn't timed, so even more reason to visit!  Also wanted to add, our waiter was excellent.

First time at Square Cafe was today for brunch. Couldn't have selected a better place. Started off with the Moroccan mint tea which was fantastic! It took me a good 15 min to narrow down my menu selection. I just couldn't  decide which yummy dish to try. I end up getting the Square breakfast with a side of French toast. The French Toast so was so fresh, light an fluffy!  The bacon an potatoes were perfectly cooked. I can't wait to go back!  Awesome food, great service, super friendly staff!

We had a Groupon for Square Cafe that was set to expire, so we were really excited to try it out. There was a line out the door, but we only waited a couple minutes to be seated. The atmosphere was awesome, with brightly colored walls adorned with locally painted artwork. The square-shaped coffee cups also added to the unique experience - especially since their coffee was fantastic.   They don't poach or baste eggs, so my wife ordered scrambled egg whites, which were covered in grease. I ordered an omelet with ham, salsa, and their "King's Pearl" cheese, which we were told was similar to feta, but actually was more like ricotta. I'll be honest, I hate ricotta cheese, so I wasn't a fan of it. I understand that some people may like it, but it just wasn't for me. I can't blame them for that.   What I can blame the kitchen for though is that I asked twice for salsa on the side, because I didn't want my eggs smothered in it, and then we both asked for our toast well done, explaining that we like it really crispy. When the food came, the bread was barely toasted and the eggs were covered in salsa. It would have taken too long to ask for the bread to be toasted more, so we just ate it.   I hate giving low ratings, but we just weren't very happy with our breakfast. I don't like to be all negative, so I will say the waitress was very friendly, the coffee was great, and the inside atmosphere was awesome. Other than that, I can't justify going back.

Go, just go to Square Cafe! You don't need to read more reviews!  Attention to detail is on point and it's obvious when you order take out. Food is always cooked properly, eggs are perfect and CRISPY bacon.   I always try to make it to this restaurant every time I visit Pitt and I'm ALWAYS happy when I go there. Have only had their breakfast and coffee and I can only imagine how delicious their other menu items are!

I found my new breakfast spot...The employees are very welcoming it feels like you're in good company, and the food was GREAT!!! We had the square breakfast and Lemon Berry ricotta pancakes oh my goodness the pancakes were too die for. I can't wait to explore the rest of the menu.

I have been here twice, and have not been disappointed yet. The service has been prompt and friendly. They have a huge selection of tea and coffee drinks. Their menu is amazing. They have a huge selection of savory and sweet breakfast items.  I got the lemon ricotta pancakes the first time, and they were fluffy and flavorful. Then I got the breakfast sandwich the second time which was really good too.   This has quickly become one of my favorite breakfast places in Pittsburgh.

Square Cafe offers gluten free options. During my last visit, our server was knowledgeable about Celiac disease and had working knowledge of cooking surfaces and cross contamination. For example, I personally could not order GF pancakes because they are cooked on the same surface as wheat pancakes. Our server checked in the kitchen and I was able to find items on the menu that won't make me sick.  I has the Pesto Chicken Salad with lemon honey dressing and a side of bacon. I ate it all. Phenomenal. Everyone in my party was pleased.  A must go for a great East End breakfast.

I found this place on Yelp and I am so glad that I did! I have been here three times now. I admit it, all three times I ordered the same exact thing- the crab spinach omelet. However, for my cafe choices, I did venture out and tried a different espresso drink each time. The raspberry has to be my absolute favorite, its sweet and loaded with caffeine.. JUST PERFECT.  The seating can be difficult since all three times we've came here that its always packed. We choose to sit at the bar stools just so we didn't have to wait too long. As we were eating, many people would come in, look at the crowd, and leave because they decided not to wait. To those people, i say NAY! Wait the 15-30 mins for a table, the food is absolutely worth it!

It's crazy what people do for eggs and bacon. Getting a table on a weekend is like the Hunger Games: brunch edition. We rolled up pretty early (or so we thought) and the entire block was filled with people waiting to be seated. Fortunately the wait wasn't as long as expected but we still stood around for at least half an hour twiddling our thumbs.   Although everyone raves about their pancakes, I came specifically for the tandoori jackfruit bowl (aaaand also the pancakes). To my disappointment, I hated it! The jackfruit was extremely salty to the point that it was inedible. It came with some kale and other misc veggies so there was no real base to offset all the salt. I also ordered the protein pancake that tasted like cardboard. I definitely regretted not going with a regular pancake.  Our waitress was so sweet and friendly, but naturally with so many people to manage, we felt neglected most of the time. It took forever to get served because the kitchen was backed up. Our table was squeezed next to another couple, so trying to have a conversation with another one going on 5 inches away was quite uncomfortable. If I ever come back, it's going to be for take-out.

The Square Cafe gets really busy on weekends, which is a tell-tale sign that this place is not messing around when it comes to food. I've never ordered something I haven't liked, and the service is always on point. They have a nice selection of beverages, and I will never forget the breakfast tostada they had on special the first time I came!!

Adorable. Laid Back. Delicious.  The staff is friendly and the place is clean and has lots of character.  The omelette ranchero is so good I struggle to leave my comfort zone.  The square mugs keep coffee hot , delicious, and eclectic.  Becoming my favorite Pittsburgh brunch spot..

I love this place so much. It's fantastic to have such an amazing diner in our neighborhood. I've never thought to write a review before. The food is always top notch. Never anything short if perfection. Fresh, local ingredients. Homemade and yummy...always!

Came here for Easter Sunday!  I had told them ahead of time on Facebook that I was coming at 11:30 with four people, that made no difference. Our name was on the list but we still had to wait 20-30 minutes for a table.   I had the vegan pancakes with one of their lattes (they made it vegan for me.) The pancakes were supposed to be peanut butter but they tasted more gingerbread spiced. They were pretty good but not amazing. My mom and brother had the lemon Berry Ricotta pancakes and enjoyed them. My dad had the jackfruit bowl and LOVED it! He wants to recreate it at home. And my friend had their green eggs and ham Special, pesto eggs with asiago cheese and tomatoes. He loved his meal and said it was better than Pamela's/DeLuca's.   I don't know if I'll be back, the vegan pancakes weren't everything I dreamed them to be.

I can't wait to go back.   Went here yesterday for brunch with the hubby.  We were told it would be a 15 minute wait, but it was closer to 10 minutes which was nice.    We were seated inside and someone was over right away to take our drink order.  My husband had a sugar free vanilla latte which he enjoyed very much.   He had the bacon avocado omlette and subbed mixed greens for the toast and hash browns.  He really enjoyed it and the bite that I had was delicious and chockfull of toppings.  He did think it was strange that the avocado was not incorporated during the cooking, but I prefered it that way since I don't like warm avocado.   I had the short rib eggs benedict.  This was absolutely out of this world.  The hollindaise actulaly tasted light which is difficult to do considering all of the delicious fat in it.  The short ribs were plentefully and were beautifully accompnied by perfectly cooked eggs.    Like I said can't wait to go back and try more of the menu, but it might be hard for me not to order that delicious eggs benedict again.

I had been looking forward to trying out this place after hearing great things from friends and seeing rave reviews on Yelp.   The first time I went was with the groupon. I had their home fries, breakfast chicken quesadilla and the walnut pumpkin pancake. The pancake was amazing - not overly sweet but delicious and satisfying. The quesdilla could have used a little more cheese and hence was a little dry but it was quite hearty. My BF thought the home fries were the best he had ever had, I thought they were good too ;) I thought it was a great deal with the groupon savings.  The second time I went without a groupon and paid full price. This time it seemed a little pricey. I got the mint hot chocolate which was very yummy, but it wasn't nearly as hot as it should have been. I went more classic with the breakfast sandwich which was fine enough, but was a little disappointed that not of the entrees really came with home fries, which is usually standard at breakfast and brunch places. Together the rather basic sandwich, small bowl of cold home fries and hot chocolate was $20+. It was good, but I probably won't go again without a deal or groupon.  Waits on the weekends are quite long and its very busy. The second time we went on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving around 10 AM and were seated at the last empty table at the time.

OH. MY. GAWD!  (This is said in the Chris Farley SNL skit voice)  From the service to the atmosphere to the food, this place is WELL worth the highest possible 5 star rating!!  As the reigning Pancake Queen (how did I get this title? I made it up!) I decided that I would do myself an injustice for not eating pancakes here.  Let me tell you, I was NOT disappointed.  Not in the least!  The Oatmeal Pancakes with peach compote, pecans, powdered sugar and whipped cream was just divine!  I've never had oatmeal pancakes and I think I'm in love!  They were incredible and since they're made with oats I'm just going to go ahead and say they were healthy (they probably weren't, oops).    We also decided to split the Omelet Ranchero.  It was packed with loads of cheesy flavor and a nice helping of salsa on top.  Served with potato's and we were in carb overload!  I almost wish we would have ordered a side of fruit instead of the wheat bread it came with just to redeem the meal into being slightly nutritional.  Whatever though, it was darn good!  The ambiance with bright walls, polka dots and fun modern artwork just matched the bright and cheery attitude of the wait staff.  It made me happy and most importantly, my tummy happy!

I have been here for brunch on several occasions.  I would recommend that you get there early because you may have to wait.  When waiting there is not an area where you and your guests can stand comfortably because this place is very popular.  The food is delicious and they have a varied menu.  You can bring your friends, parents, and kids to this place.  Great place and great food.

It's a very nice place to have breakfast/brunch with a couple of friends.  Tofu Scramble is good for those who are huge tofu fans.  Green eggs with Ham has a very unique taste which both my boyfriend and I favor!  Their coffee is more than tasty which actually surprised us. Plus, bathroom is clean.  I will suggest to buy their groupon first and go with the coupon.  We bought the option of $13 for $20 value and we will probably go again.   Better go a little early since it's very popular and the line is long.  Wait was 20 mins for us three - we got there before ten and it was pouring !!  By the time we were out of it, the line got even longer. So better go early !!  Serve is nice :P

I've been here a handful of times now and am always impressed. It is so nice to have a place with good vegetarian/local options in Regent Square! There are many items on the menu that you won't find elsewhere, which makes it easy to come back to time and time again. On my most recent visit, I rode my bike over from Shadyside, and instead of getting a food coma like I normally do after brunch, I was feeling great afterwards since my meal was not overloaded with grease like many brunch options. I tried the Smoked Salmon Omelet and also got to sample the Veggie Overload Omelet with mozzarella. Both were great! I also recommend the specialty lattes - they are delicious, especially the Snickerdoodle!  The atmosphere is cozy and very cute which its own unique flair. It is very popular for breakfast and lunch (so get there early on the weekends if you don't want to wait), but I can see how it would also be a great to come midday to study or read. I'll be back soon!

cant give enough stars. the staff here is remarkable. the are friendly and kind and professional all wrapped up in one. this is a quaint little cafe that offers a nice dining experience. you can eat inside or outside. very casual.  greeted with a smile. we did take out but next time i would love to sit and enjoy the experience. try this place. you will find the diamond in the rough. thank you to the owner and staff for taking such good care of my mom and her family during her illness.
Square is a fantastic place to grab an amazing breakfast! The wait stuff is always friendly, and the food is always delicious!  The wait times can be a bit long, but it's well worth the wait!

3.5 stars.  Square Cafe is the only place to get brunch up in Regent Square.  There was pretty good sized crowd the last time I went and there was a line around noon so it definitely does get packed.  I had their chicken and apple sausage omelet, which came with a side of home fries and toast (I chose rye).  My companion ordered their chicken and wild mushroom crepes and a side of fries (out of gluttony).  My omelet was alright; it was pretty standard and I've had better omelets before.  I typically like my home fries to be diced into larger pieces with a bit more of a char; they had a nice sprinkling of tasty seasoned salt though.  Also, I would've liked my bread toasted.  On the other hand, my companion's chicken and wild mushroom crepes were absolutely delicious.  The gooey creamy Gruyere cheese sauce brought the entire dish together.  It was topped with some diced tomatoes to add an acidic bite to the dish; I personally found this to be a questionable decision by the chef since the tomatoes contrasted so much from the rest of the dish and didn't really fit in altogether.  Her fries were fried crispy and well seasoned; I couldn't stop stealing them from her plate.  Overall Square Cafe is a nice brunch spot and I might go back once in a while, but I don't think it would be a permanent fixture in my brunch rotation.

Usually get the food delivered via Uber eats. The food always arrives piping hot. The flavors are truly exceptional they are a little more than other breakfast spots, the price is worth the quality of the food you get.

This is a very cute place off of South Braddock, close to the Green Mango. The breakfasts are flavorful, and not too greasy. I have had the breakfast burrito and the veggie omelet, both of which were quite good. My friends got the pancakes, and thought they were delicious. The house coffee is very good, and there are also specialty/gourmet coffees (latte's, etc.), but I have never tried them. This place has an artistic flair, is clean, good service, and also has several tables on the sidewalk that are in the shade during the mornings - nice and cool in the summer. Also, if you are a vegetarian/vegan, this is a very good spot (and one of the few) to go in Pittsburgh, especially for breakfast.

I went here for breakfast again this past weekend - again on a Sunday morning with the same friend whom I went with in August.  We arrived at 9:15 and the place was already packed but thankfully we only waited a few minutes before we were seated, and luckily no one needed to wait outside for a table in the below freezing temps.  The menu had some different offerings than the last time I was there so it was a nice chance to try something different.  I ordered the Brussels Sprouts Grits which were Saut√©ed Brussels sprouts, bacon, braised leeks and mushrooms served over cheesy grits with 1 egg over easy.  I also was craving something sweet so I ordered a piece of French toast on the side.  My friend ordered a breakfast sandwich with Amish cheddar and bacon.  I also ordered an almond milk latte.  Overall I enjoyed my trip to Square Cafe more than I did a few months ago.  Maybe they were having a "off" morning that morning.  The food was tasty and delivered quickly with friendly service.  I will definitely be returning again for breakfast.

We came here as party of 5 (4 adults + 1 toddler) on a Sunday morning around 8:30 am.  The place is already hopping.  Luckily there was no line yet and we were seated right away.  The place is bright-colored with limited seating outside.  The seating are also tight fit inside, but it's typical for downtown restaurant. I love all the flavor lattes they have and many unique brunch items on the menu.  Between the 4 of us, we ordered smoked salmon omelet, lemon ricotta pancakes, Brussels sprout hash, and chicken mushroom crepes.  I was IMPRESSED on how fast the food came out AND they were all very good!  We also tried the Banaoffee (banana flavor latte) and churro latte - both were yummy but on the sweet side.  I wish I live closer so I can try more things on their menu! On a side note - there are 2 unisex bathrooms - both with changing table AND a little bench for the kiddos to use to wash hands (or sit on the potty).  Very kid-friendly.  Love it.  :)
I loved this restaurant! I got the Brussel sprout hash and it's to die for. Its unlike any other restaurant I've been to. The staff were super friendly.

Having been to Square a few times now (4 I believe), I think it's safe to say this has quickly become one of my go-to's for breakfast in the Burgh. With a fun, quirky atmosphere, friendly waitstaff, and straight-forward fixings, you really can't go wrong starting your morning off at Square.  ATMOSPHERE - 4/5 Polka dots, festive hues of red; green; blue; and orange, abstract flower art hanging on the walls, and funky/retro diner seating. In a word, Fun. Square is about sharing laughs and good times over a scrumptious meal, nothing of the decor of the place would lead one to think otherwise.  DRINKS - 5/5 With a beverage menu nearly as big as their actual food menu, you may need to ask for another minute when your waiter/waitress comes to take your drink order. My 2 cents, you can't go wrong with anything from their specialty latte menu? I've tried nearly everyone and enjoyed all so far. (Pro tip: if you want it to come in the special Square cup, you'll have to order a 12 oz)  FOOD - 4/5 Serving up modern twists on classic diner breakfast dishes, Square's locally sourced, beautifully garnished plates do not disappoint any hungry patron. I recommend their Pumpkin walnut pancakes or Monte Cristo if you're feeling a sweet tooth, otherwise their breakfast sandwich or one of their hashes will do you good. I'll be avoiding their breakfast burrito as my last one was, well, bland, and there are plenty of better sounding options to try next!   Bonus points for their unique idea of giving warm, fuzzy, blue blankets to patrons who sit outside on chilly mornings, was a nice little touch that I won't soon forget.

In terms of breakfast, this is one of our favorite spots.  Among my favorite dishes are the smoked salmon scramble, crab cakes benedict, and the brussel sprouts hash.  The coffee they serve here is also very good and the mugs they use are very unique and add to the experience.

I don't like to give out 5 stars being that it's the mecca of ratings and all, but this place nailed it.  It has it all, great food, great service, and great atmosphere.    I was torn between the Salmon Tartini (I think that's what it was called) and the choriza enchillada.  I'm pretty sure neither would be a miss, but I heard through the grapevine that their chef makes the chorizo.  Thus, I was directed that way.  It was a great tasting dish, perfect for my Sunday hangover.  I also had a peanut butter and banana protein shake which I sucked down like the Hoover Dam!  It was delicious.  If you like a little live entertainment, I'd suggest hanging out at the bar and observing the very friendly, outgoing staff (all good looking women as well, always a plus!).  Before I blew that hot dog stand, I grabbed a coffee to go.  I don't know what it was, but it was the perfect blend of smooth and bold.  I can't wait until next time to try out that Salmon!

This a great spot for brunch. That being said, prepare to wait, and not just on a weekend - the weekdays are busy as well. I enjoy how they change the menu with what is seasonal, although I'm always sad when I fall in love with a dish and then it's gone... ;). The reason I went with 4 stars is because as one of my dining partners today said, "Square Cafe is really amazing 1 out of every 4 times," and, honestly, I would agree with her. Sometimes the dinning experience is straight up Mary Poppins (practically perfect in every way), and sometimes it's just good. Though square Cafe's "just good" is already way above the curve in comparison to other spots in town, even when it's not at it's best. You should go; it's definitely worth a stop - even though I regret adding to the lines... :)

Square Cafe is a wonderful breakfast place.  The staff is always friendly and quick.  The food is everything from crepes to traditional breakfast food.  There are always a number of groups hanging out and talking over breakfast - everyone is friendly.  The food, coffee and teas are all good.  I wish I got out to Regent Square more often to enjoy Square Cafe.

Square Cafe is like the bougie cousin of Eat'n'Park. Similar to the Pittsburgh chain, Square Cafe is always popping and has a substantial breakfast and lunch menu with local and fresh ingredients that is great for carnivores, vegetarians, and vegans. Despite all of that, Square Cafe is pretty standard family friendly restaurant. I wasn't really blown away by anything on the menu, but I did enjoy the outdoor seating and diner-esque decor of the restaurant. After finishing my meal here, I figured that I would be happy to come back if I was in the Regent Square/Wilkinsburg area, but I wouldn't make this restaurant a destination.
Food was great and service was poor. Had to ask for utensils. Very expensive for lunch, two salads and two coffees = $35.00.  Very crowded seating. Had people squeezing by us to get out.

I eat a work lunch here about once or twice a month and love it. The menu has a ton of fresh choices. I highly recommend the creamy chicken crepes (don't recall the actual name) and one of their exotic iced lattes. We've never had issues with the wait, and the atmosphere is a little crowded, but still friendly and open.

First things first, service was great. If you are here on a weekend or on a holiday, expect at least 15-20 minutes of wait time. Food they offer is totally worth the wait time. I was here with my friend for brunch on memorial day. We had to wait for 20 minutes to get seated. Their menu includes variety of breakfast and lunch items, so we killed the 20 minutes to decide on our order.  We ordered the Brussels sprout hash and the day's special french toast. I was intrigued by the variety of latte flavors they offer and went for the coconut flavored coffee (Smoconut if I remember the name correctly). The coffee is so refreshing and wonderful start to my day. My friend who does not like coffee stole a few sips from my cup! Do try their coffee in the special mugs they have!   The hash is packed with natural vegetable flavors of Brussels sprout, mushroom and caramelized onion served on a bed of creamy grits. I did not even think of seasoning with salt and pepper. You cant stop eating with that rich flowing egg yolk. The grits are creamy, soft and cooked to perfection. French toast is good, regular taste that you get at any good breakfast place.   We will definitely visit again, but next time, we will order the unique items they offer like the hash which I don't get at other brunch places.

Excellent food, service, location. You won't be disappointed. I had an egg white scramble with tomatoes and asparagus topped with a crumbled cheese of some sort (forgot the name) served with a side of fresh fruit and an amazing vanilla latte. Everything on the menu sounded so delicious I had a hard time choosing just one! Would 100% recommend and will definitely be back soon.

This is my new breakfast place! The food is amazing and my friends and I are determined to try the whole menu! Love the atmosphere and service. There is a wait, but it tends to be quick. The coffee is so good too!
